alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:14PM CDT until May 15 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Middle Yegua Creek near Dime Box affecting Burleson and Lee Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Middle Yegua Creek...including Dime Box...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River near Speaks. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins with the river one hundred yards wide in the vicinity of the gauge. The approaches to the FM 530 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 24.3 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.2 feet on 06/26/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Navidad River Speaks 24.0 22.2 Sat 9 pm CDT 24.2 22.9 17.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.
